required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: User Performance Evaluation of an Investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to demonstrate that untrained subjects with diabetes can use an investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS) with capillary blood obtained from fingerstick and from Alternative Site (AST) Palm .

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Self-Test Fingerstick Blood Glucose (BG) Results Within +/-15mg/dL(<75 mg/dL) or Within +/- 20% (>=75 mg/dL) of Laboratory Glucose Method
primary_outcome.description: Untrained subjects with diabetes self-test fingerstick blood using an investigational Blood Glucose Meter (BGM). BGM results are compared with capillary plasma BG results obtained with a reference lab glucose method - Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. BG meter results are used to calculate the number of BG results within +/- 15mg/dL (for reference BG results <75mg/dL) or within +/- 20%(for reference BG results >=75mg/dL) of the reference method results (YSI capillary plasma).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Alternative Site (AST) Palm Blood Glucose (BG) Results Within +/- 15mg/dL (<75mg/dL) or Within +/- 20% (>=75mg/dL) of Laboratory Glucose Method
secondary_outcome.description: Untrained subjects with diabetes self-test subject Alternative Site (AST) Palm blood using an investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS). BGM meter results are compared with capillary plasma BG results obtained with a reference lab glucose method - Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. BG meter results are used to calculate the number of BG results within +/- 15mg/dL (for reference BG results <75mg/dL) or +/- 20% (for reference BG results >=75mg/dL) of the YSI capillary plasma reference method results.

arm_group.description: Untrained subjects with diabetes (at least 70% of subjects will be insulin users) use an investigational blood glucose monitoring system (Ninja 2) to self-test capillary blood obtained from fingerstick and palm.

intervention.intervention_name: Ninja 2 Investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System
intervention.description: The Ninja 2 meter is a Bayer investigational meter that uses an investigational sensor.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males and females, 18 years of age and above
- Diagnosed as having type 1 or type 2 diabetes
- Currently self-testing blood glucose at home
- Able to speak, read, and understand English
- Willing to complete all study procedures
Exclusion Criteria:
- Blood Borne infections like hepatitis or HIV or infections such as tuberculosis
- Hemophilia or any other bleeding disorder
- Employee of competitive medical device company,immediate family member of such, or living within the household of such
- Pregnancy

group.title: Intended Users of the System
group.description: Untrained subjects with diabetes (at least 70% of subjects will be insulin users) use an investigational blood glucose monitoring system (Ninja 2) to self-test capillary blood obtained from fingerstick and palm. Ninja 2 Investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System : The Ninja 2 meter is a Bayer investigational meter that uses an investigational sensor.

group.title: Intended Users of the System
group.description: Untrained subjects with diabetes (at least 70% of subjects will be insulin users) use an investigational blood glucose monitoring system (Ninja 2) to self-test capillary blood obtained from fingerstick and palm. Ninja 2 Investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System : The Ninja 2 meter is a Bayer investigational meter that uses an investigational sensor.

outcome.title: Number of Self-Test Fingerstick Blood Glucose (BG) Results Within +/-15mg/dL(<75 mg/dL) or Within +/- 20% (>=75 mg/dL) of Laboratory Glucose Method
outcome.description: Untrained subjects with diabetes self-test fingerstick blood using an investigational Blood Glucose Meter (BGM). BGM results are compared with capillary plasma BG results obtained with a reference lab glucose method - Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. BG meter results are used to calculate the number of BG results within +/- 15mg/dL (for reference BG results <75mg/dL) or within +/- 20%(for reference BG results >=75mg/dL) of the reference method results (YSI capillary plasma).
outcome.population: 110 subjects tested one of 3 test strip lots on the BGM system. 110 (1x110) test results are available.

group.title: Intended Users of the System
group.description: Untrained subjects with diabetes (at least 70% of subjects will be insulin users) use an investigational blood glucose monitoring system (Ninja 2) to self-test capillary blood obtained from fingerstick and palm. Ninja 2 Investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System : The Ninja 2 meter is a Bayer investigational meter that uses an investigational sensor.

measure.title: Number of Self-Test Fingerstick Blood Glucose (BG) Results Within +/-15mg/dL(<75 mg/dL) or Within +/- 20% (>=75 mg/dL) of Laboratory Glucose Method
measure.description: Untrained subjects with diabetes self-test fingerstick blood using an investigational Blood Glucose Meter (BGM). BGM results are compared with capillary plasma BG results obtained with a reference lab glucose method - Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. BG meter results are used to calculate the number of BG results within +/- 15mg/dL (for reference BG results <75mg/dL) or within +/- 20%(for reference BG results >=75mg/dL) of the reference method results (YSI capillary plasma).
measure.population: 110 subjects tested one of 3 test strip lots on the BGM system. 110 (1x110) test results are available.

outcome.title: Number of Alternative Site (AST) Palm Blood Glucose (BG) Results Within +/- 15mg/dL (<75mg/dL) or Within +/- 20% (>=75mg/dL) of Laboratory Glucose Method
outcome.description: Untrained subjects with diabetes self-test subject Alternative Site (AST) Palm blood using an investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS). BGM meter results are compared with capillary plasma BG results obtained with a reference lab glucose method - Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. BG meter results are used to calculate the number of BG results within +/- 15mg/dL (for reference BG results <75mg/dL) or +/- 20% (for reference BG results >=75mg/dL) of the YSI capillary plasma reference method results.
outcome.population: One subject had low blood sugar. The protocol (and User Guide) do not allow alternative site testing when blood sugar is low. The remaining 109 subjects tested one strip lot on the BGM system. 109 test results were available.

BGM meter results are compared with capillary plasma BG results obtained with a reference lab glucose method - Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. BG meter results are used to calculate the number of BG results within +/- 15mg/dL (for reference BG results <75mg/dL) or +/- 20% (for reference BG results >=75mg/dL) of the YSI capillary plasma reference method results.
measure.population: One subject had low blood sugar. The protocol (and User Guide) do not allow alternative site testing when blood sugar is low. The remaining 109 subjects tested one strip lot on the BGM system. 109 test results were available.

reported_events.time_frame: Each subject participated for approximately 1 hour.

Ninja 2 Investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System : The Ninja 2 meter is a Bayer investigational meter that uses an investigational sensor.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
